Banach spaces, topology

Let C([0,1])C\p{\br{0,1}}C([0,1]) denote the Banach space of continuous functions on the interval [0,1]\br{0, 1}[0,1] endowed with the sup-norm. Let F\mathcal{F}F be a σ\sigmaσ-algebra on C([0,1])C\p{\br{0,1}}C([0,1]) so that for all x∈[0,1]x \in \br{0, 1}x∈[0,1], the map defined via

Lx(f)=f(x)L_x\p{f} = f\p{x}Lx​(f)=f(x)

is F\mathcal{F}F-measurable. Show that F\mathcal{F}F contains all open sets.
Solution.

Fix f∈C([0,1])f \in C\p{\br{0,1}}f∈C([0,1]) and let B={g∈C([0,1])∣∥f−g∥≥r}B = \set{g \in C\p{\br{0,1}} \mid \norm{f - g} \geq r}B={g∈C([0,1])∣∥f−g∥≥r} for some r>0r > 0r>0. Observe that by definition, ∥f−g∥≥r\norm{f - g} \geq r∥f−g∥≥r occurs if and only if for any ε>0\epsilon > 0ε>0, there exists x∈[0,1]x \in \br{0, 1}x∈[0,1] such that ∣f(x)−g(x)∣≥r−ε\abs{f\p{x} - g\p{x}} \geq r - \epsilon∣f(x)−g(x)∣≥r−ε. We parametrize ε\epsilonε via 1n\frac{1}{n}n1​ and by appealing to density of Q\QQ and continuity of f−gf - gf−g, we may replace x∈[0,1]x \in \br{0, 1}x∈[0,1] with q∈[0,1]∩Qq \in \br{0, 1} \cap \Qq∈[0,1]∩Q in the statement. Notice then that

∣f(q)−g(q)∣≥r−1n  ⟺  g(q)−f(q)≥r−1n or g(q)−f(q)≤−r+1n  ⟺  g(q)≥f(q)+r−1n or g(q)≤f(q)−r+1n  ⟺  Lq(g)≥Lq(f)+r−1n or Lq(g)≤Lq(f)−r+1n  ⟺  g∈Lq−1([Lq(f)+r−1n))∪Lq−1((−∞,Lq(f)−r+1n]).\begin{aligned} \abs{f\p{q} - g\p{q}} \geq r - \frac{1}{n} &\iff g\p{q} - f\p{q} \geq r - \frac{1}{n} \text{ or } g\p{q} - f\p{q} \leq -r + \frac{1}{n} \\ &\iff g\p{q} \geq f\p{q} + r - \frac{1}{n} \text{ or } g\p{q} \leq f\p{q} - r + \frac{1}{n} \\ &\iff L_q\p{g} \geq L_q\p{f} + r - \frac{1}{n} \text{ or } L_q\p{g} \leq L_q\p{f} - r + \frac{1}{n} \\ &\iff g \in L_q^{-1}\p{\pco{L_q\p{f} + r - \frac{1}{n}}} \cup L_q^{-1}\p{\poc{-\infty, L_q\p{f} - r + \frac{1}{n}}}. \end{aligned}∣f(q)−g(q)∣≥r−n1​​⟺g(q)−f(q)≥r−n1​ or g(q)−f(q)≤−r+n1​⟺g(q)≥f(q)+r−n1​ or g(q)≤f(q)−r+n1​⟺Lq​(g)≥Lq​(f)+r−n1​ or Lq​(g)≤Lq​(f)−r+n1​⟺g∈Lq−1​([Lq​(f)+r−n1​))∪Lq−1​((−∞,Lq​(f)−r+n1​]).​

Hence,

g∈B  ⟺  ∥f−g∥≥r  ⟺  ∀n≥1,∃q∈[0,1]∩Q:∣f(q)−g(q)∣≥r−1n  ⟺  ∀n≥1,∃q∈[0,1]∩Q:g∈Lq−1([Lq(f)+r−1n))∪Lq−1((−∞,Lq(f)−r+1n])  ⟺  g∈⋂n=1∞⋃q∈[0,1]∩Q(Lq−1([Lq(f)+r−1n))⏟∈F∪Lq−1((−∞,Lq(f)−r+1n])⏟∈F).\begin{aligned} g \in B &\iff \norm{f - g} \geq r \\ &\iff \forall n \geq 1, \exists q \in \br{0, 1} \cap \Q : \abs{f\p{q} - g\p{q}} \geq r - \frac{1}{n} \\ &\iff \forall n \geq 1, \exists q \in \br{0, 1} \cap \Q : g \in L_q^{-1}\p{\pco{L_q\p{f} + r - \frac{1}{n}}} \cup L_q^{-1}\p{\poc{-\infty, L_q\p{f} - r + \frac{1}{n}}} \\ &\iff g \in \bigcap_{n=1}^\infty \bigcup_{q \in \br{0,1}\cap\Q} \p{\underbrace{L_q^{-1}\p{\pco{L_q\p{f} + r - \frac{1}{n}}}}_{\in\mathcal{F}} \cup \underbrace{L_q^{-1}\p{\poc{-\infty, L_q\p{f} - r + \frac{1}{n}}}}_{\in\mathcal{F}}}. \end{aligned}g∈B​⟺∥f−g∥≥r⟺∀n≥1,∃q∈[0,1]∩Q:∣f(q)−g(q)∣≥r−n1​⟺∀n≥1,∃q∈[0,1]∩Q:g∈Lq−1​([Lq​(f)+r−n1​))∪Lq−1​((−∞,Lq​(f)−r+n1​])⟺g∈n=1⋂∞​q∈[0,1]∩Q⋃​⎝⎛​∈FLq−1​([Lq​(f)+r−n1​))​​∪∈FLq−1​((−∞,Lq​(f)−r+n1​])​​⎠⎞​.​

Notice that the set in the right-hand side is comprised of countable unions and intersections, hence in F\mathcal{F}F, so B∈FB \in \mathcal{F}B∈F. Since F\mathcal{F}F is closed under complements, it follows that open balls are contained in F\mathcal{F}F.

To complete the proof, it suffices to show that open balls generate the topology on C([0,1])C\p{\br{0, 1}}C([0,1]). By Stone-Weierstrass, C([0,1])C\p{\br{0, 1}}C([0,1]) is separable (e.g., via polynomials on [0,1]\br{0, 1}[0,1]), so let {fn}n\set{f_n}_n{fn​}n​ be a countable dense subset of F\mathcal{F}F. Let

U={B(fn,q)∣n≥1, q∈Q∩(0,∞)}⊆F,\mathcal{U} = \set{B\p{f_n, q} \mid n \geq 1,\ q \in \Q \cap \p{0, \infty}} \subseteq \mathcal{F},U={B(fn​,q)∣n≥1, q∈Q∩(0,∞)}⊆F,

which is countable. Now let U⊆C([0,1])U \subseteq C\p{\br{0, 1}}U⊆C([0,1]) be an arbitrary open set. Then for any f∈Uf \in Uf∈U, there exists δ>0\delta > 0δ>0 such that B(f,δ)⊆UB\p{f, \delta} \subseteq UB(f,δ)⊆U. By density, there exists a rational q<δ4q < \frac{\delta}{4}q<4δ​ and n≥1n \geq 1n≥1 such that ∥f−fn∥<q\norm{f - f_n} < q∥f−fn​∥<q and so given any g∈B(fn,q)∈Ug \in B\p{f_n, q} \in \mathcal{U}g∈B(fn​,q)∈U, we have

∥f−g∥≤∥f−fn∥+∥fn−g∥≤2q<δ2<δ,\norm{f - g} \leq \norm{f - f_n} + \norm{f_n - g} \leq 2q < \frac{\delta}{2} < \delta,∥f−g∥≤∥f−fn​∥+∥fn​−g∥≤2q<2δ​<δ,

so B(fn,q)⊆UB\p{f_n, q} \subseteq UB(fn​,q)⊆U. Thus, we may write UUU as a union of open balls in U\mathcal{U}U, hence as a countable union of open balls. Since F\mathcal{F}F is a σ\sigmaσ-algebra, it follows that U∈FU \in \mathcal{F}U∈F, which completes the proof.
